intro: Batrachium hederaceum subsp. coenosum, commonly known as the creeping wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating and produces small, yellow, spurred flowers. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread vegetatively along the ground. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in wetland ecosystems.
